programme.title: NFL Fantasy Live
programme.desc: Millions of NFL fans live in a fantasy world where survival depends on successfully navigating the twists and turns of a grueling season. After all, relying on a second-string quarterback or an untested wide receiver to come up big is usually foolhardy. Avoiding such predicaments takes plenty of preparation, and that's where "NFL Fantasy Live" comes into play. Host Marcas Grant provides the advice and analysis fantasy fans need to make winning lineup decisions. And being armed with the latest player updates, stats and trends goes a long way toward turning fantasies into championships.

programme.title: UFC Unfiltered
programme.desc: With a fight card to look forward to, Jim and Matt invite a pair of all-action veterans on to the show in Andre Fili and Roman Dolidze. A longtime friend of the show, Andre Fili returns to UFC Unfiltered for the first time as a father in one of his most thoughtful interviews yet. He talks about the life changes since welcoming his son Valor, how fatherhood has shifted his mindset inside and outside the cage, and his upcoming matchup with Christian Rodriguez. Then, Roman Dolidze joins ahead of his middleweight main event against Anthony Hernandez. He talks about rebounding from back-to-back losses to a strong win streak, what’s at stake this weekend, and what it is about the Georgian UFC fighters that keeps them so driven. Stick around as Matt and Jim make their picks for Saturday’s UFC Fight Night card!

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 28 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! Jake Piseno joins the show! After Saturday's thrilling win over the Atlas, Jake describes just how special this Outlaws team is. Jake talks growing up in Syracuse, and why his favorite school growing up did not recruit him. The boys recap a crazy weekend in the PLL. Was Hoagie right about CJ Kirst? Doogs updates his MVP rankings. Is Coach Tierney on the hot seat? All of this and more on the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show!

programme.title: Gary Owen: Breakin' Out the Park
programme.desc: In this brutally honest stand-up performance, comedian Gary Owen confesses his hilarious history of growing up in and around trailer parks.

programme.title: Gary Owen: #DoinWhatIDo
programme.desc: The so-called “Funniest Serviceman in America” draws from his multiracial experience to lambast culture wars on social media and in his own home.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Black Famous
programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.title: Steve Brown: Yeah, I Talk Like This
programme.desc: The high-pitched, high-energy voice of comedian Steve Brown is exactly how he talks in his first outrageous comedy set shot live in New York City.

programme.title: Tom Green Live
programme.desc: Following a similar format to a former online show that Tom Green hosted, "Tom Green Live" features the comic interviewing a guest from the entertainment world. Most of the hourlong episodes feature an interview with a single guest who gets grilled by Green and viewers, who are able to ask questions through video chat software. Each episode's initial broadcast airs live, allowing for a deeper look into the guest's life that might not be seen on other talk shows that edit interviews before they air. "Tom Green Live" also features less of a comedic atmosphere than his previous efforts.

programme.title: K-Von: Designer Muscles
programme.desc: Raised by a religious family in Las Vegas, half-Persian comedian K-von is an expert at removing a bad word from a joke while keeping it funny.

programme.title: Matt Braunger: Big Dumb Animal
programme.desc: Recorded live at The Bell House in Brooklyn, Big Dumb Animal is Matt Braunger at his best. He gives everyone a glimpse at what it's like to be a big dumb animal with an anger problem. He explores a vast array of topics ranging from the absurdity of a quiet Jägerbomb to his overly nice hometown of Portland, Oregon.

programme.title: Matt Braunger: Finally Live in Portland
programme.desc: The comic offers his insights on the world, and how his memorable mistakes have helped him gain a little perspective and maturity.

programme.title: Kevin Smith: Silent But Deadly Extended Edition
programme.desc: Kevin Smith is anything but quiet in this new comedy special that was recorded an hour before his heart attack in February; before he nearly died backstage, onstage he discusses his marriage, his kid and his work (or lack thereof).

programme.title: Tim Young: What World is This?
programme.desc: Tim headlines clubs all over North America.

programme.title: Dan Levy: Lion
programme.desc: Dan Levy works his way from a zebra to a lion in his new special. From his personal trainer texting him at 4am, to watching the movie "Frozen" with his kids at 6am, to even getting mugged in Beverly Hills, Dan is not afraid to talk about his exhausting life. He also shares his crippling HGTV addiction and what it's like raising a tiny Matthew McConaughey. Bonus: he'll also teach you how to cheat the massage parlor system.

programme.title: Tone Bell: Can't Cancel This
programme.desc: The comic offers his humorously uncompromising views on a more fair world, where Alaska is cold, student loans are paid, and jelly is free.

programme.title: Michael Ian Black: Very Famous
programme.desc: Michael Ian Black is very famous. Well, he’s not that famous, but he keeps telling the world he is. Filmed live in Philadelphia, Michael Ian Black’s sarcastic sense of humor comes to the stage in his latest comedy special.

programme.title: Michael Ian Black: Noted Expert
programme.desc: You know him from his hilarious work in sketch, TV, and film, but the comedian’s NYC special takes his deadpan delivery to a whole new level.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty's focus is on summer when he plants up containers for colour in the Jewel Garden. He also turns his attention to overcrowded ornamental grasses which, now they are beginning to put on growth, need to be split and replanted. Continuing her search for finding the right plant for the right place, Carol takes a close look at why plants survive in the cracks and crevices of walls and gives her recommendations for garden plants that will thrive in similar conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don welcomes us to his garden at Longmeadow and offers some tips on keeping our gardens at their best throughout the season. Carol Klein meets wildlife enthusiast Steve Head, to discover more about the wildlife that depend on our garden ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the Wimbledon tennis championships just around the corner, Joe Swift meets the gardening team responsible for the spectacular floral displays at this world-renowned event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost adds tall plants for shady conditions to his borders, demonstrates how to make a window box for growing vegetables and herbs, and gives his tips on how to grow plants successfully in peat-free compost.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty catches up with all his summer jobs in the border and the vegetable garden. Carol gets inspiration for planting combinations at Cothay Manor and Gardens, and Arit learns about slugs and snails.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gives a masterclass on the summer pruning of fruit, gives advice on maintaining ponds and plants up a pot to give colour and interest to last into the autumn months. Adam Frost travels to Brodsworth Hall in South Yorkshire to meet a head gardener who has been set the challenge of restoring the gardens to their 19th century glory.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going on a new planting project, gives advice on planting for east- and west- facing borders, starts reaping summer vegetables and sows seeds for autumn harvests. Sue Kent finds inspiration for her own garden when she explores the glorious Aberglasney Gardens in Wales, while Nick Bailey travels to Scotland to investigate a disease which is affecting trees and shrubs in both woodlands and gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow, keeping on top of seasonal maintenance as well as enjoying the plants of high summer. Adam Frost travels to Sissinghurst Castle Gardens to view a new area of the garden which was inspired by a visit to the Greek island of Delos, and in Berkshire we find out how one gardener keeps her garden full of interest in every season of the year. In West Sussex, we get tips on growing the perfect dahlia from a grower with over 50 years of experience.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Nick Bailey celebrate gardeners throughout the country who have created some truly unique gardens and made every space count. Carol meets a couple in Dorset whose garden is full of inspirational features.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty presents a masterclass on growing Mediterranean herbs, plants lily bulbs for summer scent, and in the vegetable garden, he begins to sow seeds for salad root crops. Carol Klein is in Devon, where she takes a close look at late summer planting combinations. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, there's a gardener whose passion for exotic plants and dahlias has taken over his family garden and spilled over onto his allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's all about plants for free at Longmeadow this week as Monty adds self-sown ornamental grass seedlings to the paradise garden. He also divides ferns for planting elsewhere in the garden. Advolly Richmond explores the history of lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles the perennial problem of what to grow in the shade beneath a tree, Carol Klein takes a look at the crocosmia and we meet a gardener in Derbyshire who has spent a lifetime growing and showing gladioli.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and Frances Tophill visit Wakehurst, Kew's wild botanic garden in Sussex. They not only explore the gardens but also meet the gardeners, joining in on their planting projects and finding out more about the UK's largest conservation project, the Millenium Seed Bank.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes a special guest, the Duchess of Cornwall, to Longmeadow, where she shares her love of gardening. Nick Bailey visits Knoll Gardens and gives his tips on the tall perennials which give a burst of colour towards the end of the season.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty turns his attention to containers, planting them up for drama and summer colour in the jewel garden and showing us how to repot citrus plants. In Hampshire, Joe Swift meets the designer of an award-winning contemporary garden to explore the techniques and the plants she has used to seamlessly integrate both house and garden.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Experience the thrill of fishing in the enchanting waters of the Everglades alongside the renowned Captain Danny Allen and Captain Leiza Fitzgerald. Embark on an unforgettable journey through the intricate maze of mangroves, expansive marshes, and shimmering backwaters, as these expert guides lead you to some of the most coveted fishing spots in the region.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Team200
programme.desc: Follow Chris Scmidt, one of the newest members of Team200 as he chases big bucks from the East Coast to the Midwest!

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: October is here. We start out in Nebraska, head to Kansas and end up in Georgia. Many people have been impacted by the recent hurricanes. To help those in need we are hunting does and will donate as much venison as we possibly can to the victims.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's May of 2022 and Mark Peterson is waterfowl hunting in Argentina. A year has passed since Mark conquered the North America Waterfowl Slam. During the off-season, and with Covid just a memory, his focus shifted to thoughts of South America and the waterfowl species that it holds. After a few months of research and talking with the experts at Worldwide Trophy Adventures, he laid out the plan to attempt the South America slam in 2022. With 20 species on the list, Mark is now hunting ducks below the equator as they migrate North to warmer weather. Enjoy this first installment of a 9 episode series that showcases his new quest for another single-season waterfowl slam.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Chef Jean-Paul Bourgeois and the crew are back at it for season 3 of duck camp dinners. With a historically dry year in Louisiana, the team dodges marsh fires, hunts alligators, and prepares for the opening day of teal season.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Follow the DCD crew as they head North to hunt with duck call maker Brad Eldrige. Despite tough hunting conditions brought on by a historic drought in Louisiana, the crew is able to knock down a “Tensas Limit” of wood ducks, mallards, honkers, and squirrels.

programme.title: Captain's Log

programme.title: Life On The Water

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Jared Dieguz has been fishing all his life and now that he's running his own charter business, finding a day to "scout" the sea is more important than ever.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. It’s an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: What makes you a better angler? It’s all in the details. Capt. Justin, Meredith McCord and Jeff Lange from Florida WaterSports go through the why, how and what to rig for different scenarios that bring success.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It has been a hell of a week in Mexico but the guys aren't done yet. They still have some time to lay some critters down!

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: From the ground up host Randy Birdsong will take you through the trials and tribulations of owning his first farm and grooming it to be one of the best whitetail hunting properties in the country

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys have a full camp for their first bow hunt of the season. With warm Temps and acorns falling everywhere, Nate throws a hail Mary on the last day on a buck they call "The Squiggly 8"

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: While Randy and Dustin are trying to get the farm ready for Fall plots and create new access trails, Cody is at the river living life to the fullest. Randy finally has had enough and is doing something about Cody’s lack of effort on the farm.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and Anna set out for a last minute fishing trip that runs a little late. They take a quick detour to the parent pick up line to get the kids from school, and head back out on the water to see what’s biting!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and George from Two Georges Marina battle the wind and tide on a tough day of fishing which leads Josh to fish another day, solely for revenge on the Sheepshead!

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Trophy Tautog are on the hit list for Nick and his crew as they ply the wrecks and reefs off New Jersey.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick visits the Crystal Coast of North Carolina to search out redfish and seatrout in the backwaters with Capt. Joe Tunstall and Capt. Chris Kimney.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Heavy hearts find comfort in cherished memories as the Local Knowledge crew mourns the loss of one of the greatest members of the fishing industry. Looking back on several of our episodes with our dear friend Dave Salazar, we celebrate the life of this amazing fishermen, family man, and visionary behind the world renowned Casa Vieja Lodge.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: Low country BBQ and Redfish? What more do you want?

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to the scenic Low country of South Carolina for part one of an epic two-part redfish adventure.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: The South Carolina redfish mission continues! C.A. and Stephen hunt for redfish in unfamiliar territory.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Danny heads back to his hometown for the first time in his adult life hoping to make some quick connections with his salty roots.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Experience the thrill of fishing in the enchanting waters of the Everglades alongside the renowned Captain Danny Allen and Captain Leiza Fitzgerald. Embark on an unforgettable journey through the intricate maze of mangroves, expansive marshes, and shimmering backwaters, as these expert guides lead you to some of the most coveted fishing spots in the region.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Team200
programme.desc: Follow Chris Scmidt, one of the newest members of Team200 as he chases big bucks from the East Coast to the Midwest!

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway, David Genat is cruising the Caribbean through the US and British Virgin Islands before finishing up in colorful and vibrant Puerto Rico.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: October is here. We start out in Nebraska, head to Kansas and end up in Georgia. Many people have been impacted by the recent hurricanes. To help those in need we are hunting does and will donate as much venison as we possibly can to the victims.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Danny joins his good buddy Trey Mikell in his truly wild backyard along the Nature Coast. The two of them are searching for big redfish in inches of water.

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve take their brand new Invincible 36’ out of Plantation Boat Mart to fly the kites for some early season sailfishing

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve make a big run from Plantation Boat Mart in the Invincible 36’into the green Gulf waters to fill the Yeti cooler and battle with some seas monsters.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: A day of reef fishing in Islamorada turns into a Kingfish and Yellowtail frenzy for Captains Scott and Steve.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: It only takes 3 fish to fill the Yeti cooler when Capt Scott fishes the top with kites for Wahoo and Steve pulls a big Mutton Snapper off the bottom.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve take a long run into the Gulf from Stock Island and load thecoolers with Cobia and huge Yellowtail Snapper.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve head west from Key West to battle with big kingfish and end up with plenty of meat for the smoker.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt Mike meets up with Leiza Fitzgerald and Jimmy Huddleston for a star tournament redfish tag mission.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Mike Frenette takes Blair off the coast of Louisiana to catch their limit of red snapper.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's May of 2022 and Mark Peterson is waterfowl hunting in Argentina. A year has passed since Mark conquered the North America Waterfowl Slam. During the off-season, and with Covid just a memory, his focus shifted to thoughts of South America and the waterfowl species that it holds. After a few months of research and talking with the experts at Worldwide Trophy Adventures, he laid out the plan to attempt the South America slam in 2022. With 20 species on the list, Mark is now hunting ducks below the equator as they migrate North to warmer weather. Enjoy this first installment of a 9 episode series that showcases his new quest for another single-season waterfowl slam.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Chef Jean-Paul Bourgeois and the crew are back at it for season 3 of duck camp dinners. With a historically dry year in Louisiana, the team dodges marsh fires, hunts alligators, and prepares for the opening day of teal season.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Follow the DCD crew as they head North to hunt with duck call maker Brad Eldrige. Despite tough hunting conditions brought on by a historic drought in Louisiana, the crew is able to knock down a “Tensas Limit” of wood ducks, mallards, honkers, and squirrels.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Deep in the Everglades, Capt. Jonathan Moss and Capt. Skylar Fox are on the hunt for the inshore slam and some hidden treasures of old!

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is bass fishing out on West Lake Toho with Capt. Tony Summers. Bass Beware!

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon takes outdoorsman Zac Yarbrough to look for blackfin tuna and then out deep for swordfish. They are joined by Styles Haury for some epic offshore action.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Renowned Kiteboarder Mike Walsh goes out on a windy day with Brandon to see what they can catch around the iconic lighthouses of the middle Keys.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Get to know one extraordinary person who works on the show as we go fishing with underwater cameraman and boat captain himself, Garrett Stephens.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Jared Dieguz has been fishing all his life and now that he's running his own charter business, finding a day to "scout" the sea is more important than ever.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. It’s an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: What makes you a better angler? It’s all in the details. Capt. Justin, Meredith McCord and Jeff Lange from Florida WaterSports go through the why, how and what to rig for different scenarios that bring success.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It has been a hell of a week in Mexico but the guys aren't done yet. They still have some time to lay some critters down!

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: From the ground up host Randy Birdsong will take you through the trials and tribulations of owning his first farm and grooming it to be one of the best whitetail hunting properties in the country

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys have a full camp for their first bow hunt of the season. With warm Temps and acorns falling everywhere, Nate throws a hail Mary on the last day on a buck they call "The Squiggly 8"

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: While Randy and Dustin are trying to get the farm ready for Fall plots and create new access trails, Cody is at the river living life to the fullest. Randy finally has had enough and is doing something about Cody’s lack of effort on the farm.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and Anna set out for a last minute fishing trip that runs a little late. They take a quick detour to the parent pick up line to get the kids from school, and head back out on the water to see what’s biting!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and George from Two Georges Marina battle the wind and tide on a tough day of fishing which leads Josh to fish another day, solely for revenge on the Sheepshead!

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Trophy Tautog are on the hit list for Nick and his crew as they ply the wrecks and reefs off New Jersey.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick visits the Crystal Coast of North Carolina to search out redfish and seatrout in the backwaters with Capt. Joe Tunstall and Capt. Chris Kimney.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Dragon Wars
programme.desc: Once in 500 years, ancient mythical creatures come to Earth, wreaking havoc and destruction. This time they must be stopped for good.

programme.title: The Cave

programme.desc: War widow Janet Ames (Rosalind Russell) is struck by a car, and later her doctors suspect she may have been attempting suicide. A note in her pocket lists five men whom her husband died saving in battle, and they are contacted to help Janet's recovery. The first man on the list, jaded reporter Smitty Cobb (Melvyn Douglas), is offended when Janet says she hopes to prove her husband died in vain to save five worthless men, and offers to "introduce" Janet to each of the men through hypnotism.

programme.title: Duffy
programme.desc: A professional smuggler gets involved in a scheme by two half-brothers to steal a fortune from their wealthy father’s yacht in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: The Goddess
programme.desc: As a child, she was Emily Ann, a poor girl in the South with no friends and an ineffective mother. But as an adult, she's Rita Shawn (Kim Stanley), an actress loved the world over. Still, all the money and fame in the world can't buy happiness, and Rita is plagued with depression over her broken relationships -- first to a handsome soldier (Steve Hill) and then to a boxing promoter (Lloyd Bridges) -- and her lack of any emotional connections to anyone outside of her professional life.

programme.title: Hook, Line and Sinker
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Peter decides to go out with a bang— racking up $100,000 in credit card debt—only to find he's not dying after all.

programme.title: A Woman of Distinction
programme.desc: To garner publicity for the college, a press agent plants a story in the press about a torrid affair between an icy dean and a visiting professor.

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: Reporter Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) is aboard a U.S. Navy ship sailing near the Arctic Circle, on assignment to write a profile of Capt. Eric Finlander (Richard Widmark), a hardened anti-communist. Despite the concerns of Munceford, medical officer Chester Potter (Martin Balsam) and others on the ship, Finlander is shadowing a Soviet submarine on patrol in the same area, hoping to make it to surface. The cat-and-mouse game, however, turns deadly serious.

programme.title: Three on a Couch
programme.desc: An artist hopes to move to Paris, but his psychiatrist fiancée fears abandoning her patients, so he dons various disguises to cure the lonesome women.

programme.title: Don't Knock the Twist
programme.desc: Dancers prepare for a TV special on the twist in this musical featuring performances of chart-topping hits from the heyday of rock 'n' roll.

programme.title: Tight Spot
programme.desc: A lawyer springs a wise-cracking model from jail to convince her to testify against a no-good mobster, but a besotted cop throws a wrench in the plan.

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: An English couple in Kenya raises an orphaned lion cub to adulthood. When a warden demands she be sent to a zoo, they train her to live in the wild.

programme.title: Convicted
programme.desc: During a barroom brawl, Joe Hufford (Glenn Ford) accidentally kills the son of a powerful, prominent man. The district attorney, George Knowland (Broderick Crawford), wins a manslaughter conviction, despite having doubts about the defendant's guilt. Joe is sent to prison, and George, who eventually becomes the warden there, hopes to get him released. But Joe gets so immersed in the culture and codes of the jailhouse that he finds it difficult to believe in his own innocence.

programme.title: Picnic
programme.desc: Based on the play by William Inge.

programme.title: Dead Reckoning
programme.desc: A war hero steps off a train and into a world of gambling, blackmail and murder while searching for a fellow vet who inexplicably disappeared himself.

programme.title: The Silencers
programme.desc: It's up to secret agent Matt Helm to save the day when a megalomaniac and his dastardly organization plot to sabotage America's atomic missile system.

programme.title: Born Yesterday

In an effort to make Billie more socially acceptable, Harry hires journalist Paul Verrall (William Holden) to smarten her up -- and sparks soon fly between the pair.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: The Hellions

programme.title: The Black Dakotas

programme.title: Texas Cyclone

programme.title: Wyoming Renegades
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Phil Carey) and his girlfriend (Martha Hyer) cannot start over until they stop Butch Cassidy's (Gene Evans) gang.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: Dr. Allen Seward (Robert Francis) is the new doctor at a remote Army outpost. His liberal attitudes towards Native Americans become a source of tension between him and his superiors, especially Capt. Peter Blake (Philip Carey), who regards all Native Americans as dangerous and untrustworthy. Seward's insistence on treating several local Kiowa tribespeople for malaria further enrages Blake, who deems Seward a traitor when the Kiowa join forces with the Comanches and attack the fort.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: An Army lieutenant (George Montgomery) is ordered to go after Florida Indians in Texas.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wounded rancher (Randolph Scott) hides with a schoolmarm (Ellen Drew) after his ex-girlfriend's husband (Alexander Knox) runs him out of town.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: Fools' Parade
programme.desc: The year is 1935, and James Stewart has been released from prison after serving a 40-year sentence. He wants nothing more than to claim the $25,000 waiting for him in a local bank, but the president of the bank doesn't want him to have it.

programme.title: Rockin' in the Rockies
programme.desc: Shorty Williams (Moe Howard) is put in charge of his cousin's ranch, but he is more concerned with becoming a prospector. He comes across two drifters (Larry Fine, Curly Howard) who just got lucky at the roulette table and befriends them as possible investors. Shorty also meets singer Betty (Gladys Blake) and her partner (Mary Beth Hughes) and convinces them to stay on the ranch along with the vagrants. Unfortunately, Shorty's cousin, Rusty (Jay Kirby), returns early and isn't pleased.

programme.title: Texas
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers Dan (William Holden) and Tod (Glenn Ford) look to Texas for opportunities when the war ends. Upon witnessing a stagecoach robbery, the close friends ambush the outlaws and confiscate the stolen funds. Tod wishes to return the money, but Dan wants to keep it. After a sheriff gives chase, each man runs off on his own. They are reunited after some time, but with Tod now an honest ranch hand and Dan an outlaw cattle rustler, the two do not know if their friendship can survive.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: Whirlwind Raiders
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his singing sidekick (Smiley Burnette) stop bogus Texas lawmen.

programme.title: The New Daughters of Joshua Cabe
programme.desc: While posing as his daughters, three women discover an elderly homesteader has been falsely imprisoned for murder and hatch a plot to smuggle him out.

programme.title: Cyclone Fury

programme.desc: Lasalle hopes to avenge his brother's murder by tracking a drug ring in Alabama he believes is responsible; when Pride assists with the case, he crosses paths with Eddie Barrett, an elusive individual who knows more than he is sharing.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When Pride is unable to sleep due to continuing nightmares about the mysterious man in the red suit, he undergoes a specialized treatment to help him figure out the man's identity; an arrogant new officer joins the team.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Tammy must protect a teenage girl after her father is shot in their home; the rest of the team searches for a motive.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Midsomer Magna are thrilled when a production crew arrives at the local manor house to film a version of The Scarlet Pimpernel. But the crew members aren't the only visitors to the area - Jones has spotted notorious criminal George Ince nearby. But when the director, Nick Cheney, is found dead - his head severed by a prop guillotine - Barnaby must discover who would have wanted the victim dead. It soon becomes clear that things are not so simple, and the detectives soon have to shift through varying motives, layered by lies, hidden truths, and a possible robbery to be committed.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is in Midsomer Holm, bidding farewell to reformed criminal Ronnie Tyler, who has taken part in a rehabilitation scheme in the village. Also present is disgraced ex-policeman Jack Colby, a former colleague of Barnaby's – but Jack refuses to talk to his old friend. When Jack is murdered, the detective must delve into the dark secrets in the victim's past. There are certainly dark secrets to uncover, and Barnaby has to determine whether the victim's part in a scandal years earlier at Causton police station, is key to the mystery behind his death. It isn't long before he finds that Eddie Marston is attempting blackmail, and soon murdered as a result, and that Lord Holm is in love with Jack's wife, psychotherapist Gina.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and Speedle investigate the manufacture of lethal drugs at mobile labs; an elderly woman is murdered at a senior citizen home.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A serial rapist is found dead of suffocation; investigators probe the murders of a crematorium owner and a girl found behind the crematorium.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Team members meet an environmental lawyer who has radiation poisoning after they are exposed to radiation during an investigation.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A man stands trial for a murder he didn't commit, while Horatio and the team race to find the real killer.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Routine disposal of drug evidence goes horribly wrong, leaving two police officers dead and the CSI team under investigation.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio wants to question a murder victim's boyfriend, but the FBI won't divulge his location; Calleigh's father pays a visit.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: An ex-con asks Horatio to help him find his missing son; Speedle investigates a man's death by asphyxia.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Marks on a female corpse on a beach lead Horatio to think the perpetrator is a serial killer who bites victims; Calleigh and Delko investigate a murder at a motel pool.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates when a fire engulfs a popular night club, killing 16 people and injuring 58 others.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team delves into "tweaker" culture after a brutal murder is followed by a near-fatal explosion at the home of a methamphetamine addict.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio witnesses a dramatic prison break and later discovers one of the escapees is a child molester/murderer he put away six months earlier.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A playboy who enjoys diplomatic immunity becomes Horatio's prime suspect after a model is killed in a hit-and-run accident during Fashion Week.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio delves into the world of modern treasure-hunting after a victim is found skewered to his yacht with a harpoon.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team finds a rape victim clinging to life after being beaten, and Horatio suspects an imprisoned rapist is somehow responsible for the attack.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for £400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Little Worthy, Bob Moss was about to open up his beloved model village, when he found a gruesome extra attraction. Young local, Richard Tanner, had been stabbed in the side and his corpse tied down like Gulliver in Lilliput. Barnaby and Jones wonder who wanted him dead, but when the woman he was secretly meeting is killed during the village's Crazy Craft race, the pair have to delve in and discover who might be lying and hiding secrets.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the loose, one known as "the Creeper", but the wave of burglaries he or she have committed, seem to have finally led to murder, when David Roper (Rik Mayall) is found smothered in his bed on the Chettham family estate. Yet Barnaby and Jones learn he may have been planning to write a book that could have been quite uncomfortable for someone, leading the pair to determine whether members of the Chettham family, or their friends, were responsible.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: New DCI John Barnaby arrives in Midsomer and is bemused by the quaint villages and their quirky residents. But when a local DJ is crushed to death at a traditional girls' boarding school, he soon discovers that murder and deception are never far away. As the death toll rises, could Barnaby's first case also be his last?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The reclusive lives of elderly eccentrics William and Mary Bingham (Edward Fox and Phyllida Law) comes under police scrutiny when a social services investigator (Jeff Rawle) is murdered. Barnaby and Jones must unearth generations of family secrets and decipher astronomical charts to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young woman is dressed like a bride and drowned in a bath, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-copper and former brothel madam. With the serial killer still at large, could history be repeating itself?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Jones goes undercover at the Oblong Foundation after one of the cult's young female members disappears suddenly. But he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In Midsomer Mow, the gruesome discovery of a farmer's eviscerated body in an ancient stone circle is made just days before the spring equinox.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A VAT inspector goes missing as he hunts for an illicit cider still responsible for brewing The Beast, a potent local hooch. At the Midsomer Abbas spring fayre which celebrates its friendship with Midsomer Herne, Barnaby and Jones sample the local cider, while temperance preacher Norman Grigor calls on residents to repent of their drunken ways. Suddenly, Barnaby is violently ill as the body of missing man Peter Slim is found floating in the cider vat. Meanwhile Samuel Quested (Warren Clarke), the traditionalist mayor of Midsomer Abbas, seeks to revive the ancient rite known as 'The Stag'.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is strangled to death. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A row between keen birdwatchers in Midsomer-in-the-Marsh turns nasty when their president is killed. Patrick Morgan met his death while hoping to sight a rare bird, but is his obsession with ornithology to blame - or something more sinister?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Troy arrive in the sleepy village of Badger's Drift to investigate the sudden death of elderly Miss Emily Simpson, her next door neighbour insists that she had been murdered, after she had seen her return from a walk in the woods, unnerved and shocked by something she had witnessed. When the post mortem confirms her death was no accident, the pair discover that nothing is what it seems to be within the little village as they try to find out what exactly she saw. Their investigation introduces Barnaby and Troy to many eccentric and quirky residents and soon turns up a web of sex, blackmail and lies, and the possibility that the murder could be connected to a shooting accident two years ago, which claimed another woman's life.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After debating on who their next guest speaker should be, the Midsomer Worthy Writers' Circle decide to invite famous writer, Max Jennings, to their next meeting, despite opposition to the choice by Gerald Hadleigh, the group's chairman. When Hadleigh is found dead the day after Jennings visit, brutally bludgeoned and stripped naked, Barnaby and Troy discover that the victim had many mysteries to him, prompting them to delve into his private life and his past. Matters soon become complicated when Jennings disappears and is later found dead, and a witness recalls seeing a mysterious woman in Hadleigh's house the night before his murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst investigating the murder of Agnes Gray, a quiet animal-loving woman who was bludgeoned to death and found floating in a river near to the village of Ferne Basset, Barnaby gets more than he bargained for when he attends his wife's performance in the Causton Amateur Dramatics' production of Amadeus. When Agnes's cousin, Esslyn Carmichael, inadvertently cuts his own throat during the final act, it's quickly discovered that the tape on the prop blade he had used was removed without anyone knowing. The detective is left wondering who had wanted to turn Esslyn's final act into a true coup de theatre, as he and Troy try to determine what the motive was behind the two murders.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Some of the sweetest rides the classic car world has ever seen are auctioned off, with no reserve, at the world-famous Barrett-Jackson in lucky Las Vegas.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: A 1967 Eleanor Tribute is just one of the many Fords and Chevys auctioned off, at no reserve, for hundreds of thousands of dollars to the highest bidders.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: A classic car of a Vegas performer sells for six figures, and a hypercar starts zooming toward a million.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The heat is on, and the auction block is on fire when the Barrett-Jackson auction continues in Las Vegas; bidders go head-to-head, and only one can win.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Six-figure cars are the stars when bidders engage in a head-to-head competition to own these cars at the Barrett-Jackson auction in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: A bevy of vehicles takes center stage before the Las Vegas edition of the famous Barrett-Jackson auction closes.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: For the first time ever, Barrett Jackson, the greatest collector car auction in the world makes it way to New Orleans where the party never stops.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The party continues in New Orleans with the world's greatest collector car auction Barrett Jackson as a collection of high-priced cars cross the auction block at no reserve. Watch as bidders compete to win a limited-edition Ford GT Hennessy.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: There's no place like New Orleans as Barrett Jackson continues to roll through the birthplace of jazz with stunning cars and jaw-dropping prices.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Let the good times roll as the high-octane auction hits the auction block in New Orleans. Six-figure sales continue as bidders go head-to-head on a 1967 Ford Mustang Eleanor Tribute.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The party comes to a close in New Orleans; cars, restomods, classics, and trucks take center stage in hopes of making bidders' dreams come true.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: It's time to cowboy up and wrangle a winner as Broncos, Mustangs and Camaros stampede down the block of the Barrett-Jackson auction in Houston, Texas.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The Scottsdale auction continues full speed ahead as a wide-ranging selection of Ford and Chevy custom coupes and pick-ups cross the auction block; from a 1937 Ford 5-Window Custom Coupe, and a 1940 Ford Deluxe Custom Coupe.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Some of the rarest collector cars cross the auction block, including a limited edition Lincoln luxury sedan with suicide doors, a McLaren MP4-12, Mustangs and a 2018 Ford GT.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, the crew nearly topples the yarder; a drastic toothache remedy; Chapman races a storm in Florida.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard and Oakes are forced to share the same landing; Shelby gets in hot water with the law over a contested log; Joe and Coatsy struggle to get the Papac crew back on track; the Dreadknots have a run-in with Fish and Wildlife.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The end of the season approaches; a boat crash stops Shelby in his tracks; Gabe's crew does a favor for Oake's crew, to his dismay.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A chainsaw accident leaves the crew short-handed; Jason flips a loaded trailer; Shelby finds out if he filled his board foot order.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A look back at the logging legacies of the companies who have made it this far; new rivals storm in to claim their own share of the green gold.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, Rygaard goes deep into their roughest terrain yet in an attempt to recapture the title; in Alaska, Papac's dreams of a repeat are shattered when Coatsy's badly injured; in Canada, a new candidate steps into the ring.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Alaska, the Papac team struggles to find someone to fill the shoes of injured Coatsy; Gabe Rygaard and his crew scramble to make up for their slow start; In Wyoming, David Zitterkopf and Sons keep their chainsaws humming.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Alaska, Papac initiates an extremely dangerous process called Shotgun Logging; in Wyoming, the Zitterkopf men take the Bear Ranch site by storm; at Rygaard, the team doubles the yarders to increase production.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby uses an airboat to search for century-old logs; Rygaard attempts to move a six-ton cypress; David's sons hold down the fort while he delivers a load of logs to the mill; the Dreadknots suffer a late-day accident.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby tries to repair his custom-made buggy; David Zitterkopf makes a dangerous swing between trees; the Dreadknots go logging in the night; Triack is at a disadvantage when a crew member is injured.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Louisiana, Shelby and his assistant Bob go out looking for logs on his repaired swamp buggy; In Central Florida, the Chapman crew goes to fight against the legendary Gump log.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby goes to Lake Ponchartrain with Belinda and Bob to obtain a huge log he marked years ago; In Florida, it's round two for the Chapman and Gump log; things go from bad to worse for the bare bones Rygaard crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Rygaards go old school to keep the team on track; Shelby and Bob find a valuable sinker cypress; the Zitterkopf crew tries to take on a dangerous tangle of logs known as "the teepee of death."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Everyone comes together to plan a surprise wedding for Phil and Kay, setting up a special ceremony on their land, which the whole family attends. Si distracts Phil and Kay by taking them on a "trip down memory lane" to different places.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After discovering that Martin has to miss a Friday night poker game for a planned date, the guys (as well as their wives) take turns figuring out the best way to coach him for romance.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys realize that Godwin has never really asked them for a favor, even though they are all always helping each other out.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Due to construction at Jase and Missy's house, Willie and Korie invite Jase and the kids to live with them while Missy is out of town visiting friends.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Because of a termite problem at Duck Commander, the guys are forced to find a different location to work from--Godwin's House.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: John Luke and Sadie are getting some dental work done, complete with sedation, and it's up to Willie and Korie to take care of them through the process.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si shows up to work on a mobility scooter, claiming to have an invisible injury from a fender bender with Willie. After losing her beloved turtle "Mr. T", Ms.Kay enlists Phil on a mission to find a new pet turtle.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A decision to try and make some duck jerky leads the boys to Godwin's garage and a minibike race. Phil and Kay have made Willie the executor of their will, and Phil wants to show Willie what he and his brothers will inherit.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si discovers Youtube, and, after watching a series of instructional videos, decides he can make something better.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons host a Halloween event at Duck Commander, where they all come together to transform the warehouse into a "scarehouse."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons perform a live nativity for their Church for Christmas, so the wives organize rehearsals to ensure that they pull off a great event.

programme.desc: After seeing footage Jep shot using a GoPro, Si decides he wants to use the camera to record a day in his life. But when Si gets on the guys nerves while they're hunting, they kick him and his GoPros out of the blind.

programme.desc: After visiting a popular burger restaurant, Willie and Jase get into a debate over which of them cooks the best burger, prompting them to challenge one another to a cooking contest.

programme.desc: When Willie and Jase argue over an old GI Joe toy, it leads them into a debate over who would make a better soldier.
